The starting offset of <code>I</code> within the vtable initializer is <code>StartingOffset</code>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> discovered function pointers are added to <code>VTableFuncs</code> along with their cumulative offset within the initializer.

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// references basic block address we can&#39;t import it separately from function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// containing that basic block. For simplicity we currently don&#39;t import such</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// global vars at all. When importing function we aren&#39;t interested if any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BFI != </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;&amp; Hotness == <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calleeinfo/#a2413e35985411a461b9ab03c17c01caaa88183b946cc5f0e8c96b2e66e1c74a7e">CalleeInfo::HotnessType::Unknown</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal">          uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/asmprinter/asmprinter-cpp/#a9541bbf765f7db0b078a45d6f43c34b4a8cb28931840da67702e5bd9068512905">BBFreq</a> = BFI-&gt;getBlockFreq(&amp;BB).getFrequency();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">          uint64&#95;t EntryFreq = BFI-&gt;getEntryFreq().getFrequency();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If F is imported, a local linkage ifunc (e.g. target&#95;clones on a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// static function) called by F will be cloned. Since summaries don&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// track ifunc, we do not know implementation functions referenced by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the ifunc resolver need to be promoted in the exporter, and we will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// get linker errors due to cloned declarations for implementation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// functions. As a simple fix, just mark F as not eligible for import.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Non-local ifunc is not cloned and does not have the issue.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By now we processed all instructions in a function, except</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-volatile loads and non-volatile value stores. Let&#39;s find</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ref edges for both of instruction sets</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="normal">    AddRefEdges(NonVolatileLoads, LoadRefEdges, Visited);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can add some values to the Visited set when processing load</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions which are also used by stores in NonVolatileStores.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example this can happen if we have following code:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// store %Derived&#42; @foo, %Derived&#42;&#42; bitcast (%Base&#42;&#42; @bar to %Derived&#42;&#42;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %42 = load %Derived&#42;, %Derived&#42;&#42; bitcast (%Base&#42;&#42; @bar to %Derived&#42;&#42;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00622" /><CodeLine lineNumber="622"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="623"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// After processing loads we&#39;ll add bitcast to the Visited set, and if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we use the same set while processing stores, we&#39;ll never see store</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to @bar and @bar will be mistakenly treated as readonly.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="626"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;const llvm::User &#42;, 8&gt;</a> StoreCache;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="normal">    AddRefEdges(NonVolatileStores, StoreRefEdges, StoreCache);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
